intro: Veronica sajanensis, commonly known as the Sajan speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
